intro: Botrychium lunaroides, commonly known as the moonwort, is a small fern belonging to the family Onocleaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a single, bifurcated frond that resembles a crescent moon. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Botrychium lunaroides is a rare and ancient species, with a lineage dating back to the Paleozoic era.
